<@U25PYL3Q8> right now it’s only for Sales or Service hub enterprise pages. The serverless functions included in the developer projects are using file-based method - we call it app functions, and you don’t need CMS hub for app functions. And not via endpoint (although endpoint functions will work if you have CMS enterprise).

We are looking at simplifying this for serverless functions viewpoint. However for your case, it doesn’t help. You need the beta for Marketing and Operation Hub, which is not supported yet. Can you tell me more about the use cases for Marketing and Operations Hub?

It’ll also help if you post that information on the community group <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CRM-Development-Tools-Beta/gh-p/crm-development-tools-beta> or Ideas forum
Re-reading your message - it seems your client doesn’t have Sales/Service ent, and this beta is available. Can you DM me their HubSpot account/portal ID?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04A3FUK8HK/p1673993013356179?thread_ts=1673992211.997549&cid=C04A3FUK8HK>
Beta is not available he can go the crm toolkit though
I’m able to access thorugh the url by changing portal Id, so maybe that is just not in the UI and they didn’t lock it out based on subscription (the page view)

As far as the use case — and I’ll write it up in more detail on the community post, but here is the quick version

Client does credit checks on incoming customers and then creates loan packages for them.

We’ve engaged with the client and we are building them out a webapp that integrates with HubSpot.

Form Submission, workflow hits our webapp. Webapp connects to credit api, returns a report as well as some other data to the workflow to populate the contact record with the data.

We are going to move this to an “evaluation” object.

So after the client reviews this evalation, they do some calculations and income input, then they are going to build out a proposal of loan packages to sell them.

We have loans as an object, which are the individual loans that have a lender object that houses details on lender, rates, states accessible, etc.

Loans bubble up to the deal. So adding new loans adds more value to a deal. A deal is how they manage their revenue as well as invoicing and contract.

For someone to see the entirety of this, they need to click through so many different associated objects.

So, ideally, on the *contact record* (_and other objects will have slight variations of this, but I’m trying to be brief so I’m only including the contact_) we would want to display the loans that are active, some other related details from the loan properties, the deal amount, the posisble revenue, as well as have the quick links to their report PDF and their customer information inside our webapp, as well as their evaluation.

Hey everyone,
I am working on a card that takes an input form the end user. On submit of the card, it hits a 3rd party api and returns some data. I have gotten this working with a “Message” component that flashes the data once it’s received. Ideally I would like to put the information into a card component so that it isn’t “flashed” and instead is just there. I haven’t gotten a solution for this working yet. Has anyone worked on something similar and/or know if this would be feasible?
